{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is an ALK-positive neoplasm, we need to look for information about ALK-positive neoplasms in the provided documents. Document [0] mentions that ALK-positive neoplasms include anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALCL) of T- and NK-cell origin, inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor (IMT), neuroblastoma, non-small cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC), undifferentiated anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, and rare types of sarcomas. Document [2] specifically mentions ALK-positive large B-cell lymphoma (ALK+ LBCL) as a rare variant of large B-cell lymphoma. Document [6] also mentions that ALK-positive ALCL is a distinct entity within the group of CD30+ lymphomas. Based on this information, the correct answer is D. Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor.", "answer_choice": "D"}
